comment.text: This translation key is used to display a label indicating that a feature or action is restricted to space users only. It appears in a share component and is triggered by the "SpaceUsersOnly" internal property.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "خاص بمستخدمي {{productName}} فقط" while understandable, is not the most natural phrasing in Saudi Arabic. A more common and idiomatic translation would emphasize exclusivity.
The translation 'Yalnız {{productName}} istifadəçiləri' is a literal translation that may not convey the intended meaning. A more natural phrasing might emphasize exclusivity or restricted access.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like 'Sadece {{productName}} istifadəçiləri üçün' or '{{productName}} istifadəçiləri ilə məhduddur'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "{{productName}} users only" implies exclusivity. While the Czech translation "Pouze uživatelé {{productName}}" is literally "Only users {{productName}}", it doesn't fully capture the nuanced meaning of 'users only'. A more accurate translation might emphasize the restriction to users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using a translation like "Pouze pro uživatele {{productName}}" (Only for {{productName}} users) or "Výhradně pro uživatele {{productName}}" (Exclusively for {{productName}} users) to better convey the intended meaning.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Nur {{productName}}-Benutzer' is not the most natural or idiomatic way to express '{{productName}} users only' in German. It lacks a proper article and phrasing.

The use of a hyphen in '{{productName}}-Benutzer' is not always appropriate, particularly if 'productName' contains multiple words. Using 'Nutzer' rather than 'Benutzer' is also more common in this context.

The translation 'Μόνο για χρήστες {{productName}}' is a literal translation of 'users only'. A more natural and idiomatic Greek translation would be something like 'Αποκλειστικά για χρήστες {{productName}}' (Exclusive to {{productName}} users) or 'Διαθέσιμο μόνο για χρήστες {{productName}}' (Available only to {{productName}} users).

The translation "միայն {{productName}}-ի օգտվողների համար" literally translates to 'only for the users of {{productName}}'. While not entirely wrong, it's a bit clunky and doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'users only'. A more natural and accurate translation would emphasize exclusivity.
While technically correct, 'Somente usuários do {{productName}}' is a bit stiff and less natural-sounding in Brazilian Portuguese. A more fluent translation would use 'apenas'.

The translation 'Doar utilizatorii {{productName}}' is not the most natural or accurate translation of '{{productName}} users only'. A more idiomatic Romanian translation would be 'Numai utilizatorii {{productName}}' or 'Doar utilizatorii {{productName}}'. While 'Doar' is acceptable, 'Numai' more closely conveys the exclusivity implied by 'only'.

The translation "{{productName}} පරිශ්‍රීලකයින් පමණි" is not the most natural or accurate translation of "{{productName}} users only."  While "perishreelikayin" (පරිශ්‍රීලකයින්) translates to 'users', the phrasing is somewhat formal and less common. A more natural translation would be something along the lines of "{{productName}} යොදා ගන්නන් පමණි" or "{{productName}} ක්‍රියාකරන්නන් පමණි".

The translation 'Само {{productName}} корисници' literally translates to 'Only {{productName}} users'. A more natural and idiomatic translation in Serbian (Cyrillic) would be 'Само за кориснике {{productName}}' or 'Само за {{productName}} кориснике'.

The Serbian translation uses 'korisnici' (users) in the nominative case, but the English phrase implies exclusivity. A more accurate translation would use the genitive case to indicate possession or belonging.
The translation 'Chỉ người dùng {{productName}}' while understandable, isn't the most natural or idiomatic way to express '{{productName}} users only' in Vietnamese. It's a bit literal.
The translation doesn't convey the 'only' aspect as effectively as the original. While 'Chỉ' can imply exclusivity, it's not as direct.

The translation 'Vetëm përdoruesit e {{productName}}' is technically correct but sounds slightly unnatural in Albanian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Vetëm përdoruesit {{productName}}' or 'Vetëm {{productName}} përdoret'.
